meanings.definition: A book containing records of illustrative cases, especially in law or medicine.
meanings.sent1: I found valuable information in the casebooks at the library.
meanings.sent2: The lawyer referred to the casebooks to prepare for the trial.
meanings.sent3: The doctor accidentally mixed up the casebooks and created a hilarious misunderstanding.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was like a library full of casebooks, each one holding a different story.
meanings.sent5: The casebooks on the shelf seemed to whisper secrets of past cases.

meanings.definition: A book in which detailed records of a particular case or cases are kept.
meanings.sent1: The detective carefully examined the casebooks for clues.
meanings.sent2: She kept all her important notes in the casebooks on her desk.
meanings.sent3: The casebooks fell off the shelf one by one, creating a comical scene.
meanings.sent4: His memory was like a messy stack of casebooks, each one representing a different event.
meanings.sent5: The casebooks were like treasure chests, holding the keys to solving mysteries.
